customer_name: WINCHESTER AQUARIUM & PET CENTER L L C

citations.narrative:
The metal wire on top of the quarantined bird enclosure has not been maintained in good repair to protect the birds from
injury. The plastic coating on the bars is peeling and flaking in many areas. Also, there are two large cracks in the plastic
lid that have exposed sharper edges. Flaking coating on metal bars and cracks in plastic can lead injury or illness in the
birds. The facility replaced the cracked lids at the time of inspection. Correct by 24 April 2024 by ensuring all housing
structures are kept in good repair to protect the animals from injury.

The facility has not reviewed their contingency plan and documented the renewal annually. The last time the contingency
plan was reviewed was in September 2022. Annual review of a contingency plan is important to ensure that potential
disasters and emergencies have been addressed in the plan and it is still up to date and functional to include the species
at the facility. Correct by 1 May 2024 by reviewing and updating the contingency plan as necessary at least annually and
documenting all reviews and changes.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
The facility does not have a developed and documented environmental enhancement plan for the birds at the facility.
Failure to develop and document an environmental enhancement program for birds can negatively impact their health and
well-being, causing unnecessary psychological distress. Correct by 8 May 2024 by developing, documenting, and
following a species-appropriate plan for environmental enhancement that is adequate to promote the psychological well-
being of the birds. The plan must be approved by the attending veterinarian and must be in accordance with the
regulations in subpart G and with currently accepted professional standards as cited in appropriate professional journals
and reference guides. This plan must be made available to APHIS upon request. The plan must address each category
listed in 3.154.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
